message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
As a primary or secondary school teacher from Poland responding to a survey about AI in education, I need to provide thoughtful responses to each statement. Let me consider each one carefully based on my perspective as an educator:

[TT4G35A] - AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans: I would say "Agree" - this is a realistic capability of AI tools that can generate content and suggestions for lessons.

[TT4G35B] - AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities: I would say "Agree" - AI can help personalize content based on student performance and abilities.

[TT4G35C] - AI assists teachers in supporting students individually: I would say "Agree" - AI-powered tutoring systems and adaptive learning platforms can provide individualized support.

[TT4G35D] - AI supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs): I would say "Agree" - AI has real potential here with translation tools, text-to-speech, and adaptive learning systems.

[TT4G35E] - AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks: I would say "Strongly agree" - this is one of the most evident uses of AI, from grading assistance to scheduling.

[TT4G35F] - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own: I would say "Strongly agree" - this is a real concern with AI tools like ChatGPT that can generate text that students might pass off as their own.

[TT4G35G] - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct: I would say "Agree" - AI systems can make errors and inappropriate suggestions; this is a known limitation.

[TT4G35H] - AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions: I would say "Agree" - this is a documented concern where AI trained on biased data can perpetuate misconceptions.

[TT4G35I] - AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data: I would say "Agree" - data privacy is a legitimate concern when using AI systems with student information.


[TT4G35J] - AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students: I would say "Agree" - AI might recommend teaching methods that don't fit established best practices or the particular needs of my classroom context.

reasoningText.text:
As a primary or secondary school teacher from Poland responding to a survey about AI in education, I need to provide thoughtful responses to each statement. Let me consider each one carefully based on my perspective as an educator:

[TT4G35A] - AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans: I would say "Agree" - this is a realistic capability of AI tools that can generate content and suggestions for lessons.

[TT4G35B] - AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities: I would say "Agree" - AI can help personalize content based on student performance and abilities.

[TT4G35C] - AI assists teachers in supporting students individually: I would say "Agree" - AI-powered tutoring systems and adaptive learning platforms can provide individualized support.

[TT4G35D] - AI supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs): I would say "Agree" - AI has real potential here with translation tools, text-to-speech, and adaptive learning systems.

[TT4G35E] - AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks: I would say "Strongly agree" - this is one of the most evident uses of AI, from grading assistance to scheduling.

[TT4G35F] - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own: I would say "Strongly agree" - this is a real concern with AI tools like ChatGPT that can generate text that students might pass off as their own.

[TT4G35G] - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct: I would say "Agree" - AI systems can make errors and inappropriate suggestions; this is a known limitation.

[TT4G35H] - AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions: I would say "Agree" - this is a documented concern where AI trained on biased data can perpetuate misconceptions.

[TT4G35I] - AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data: I would say "Agree" - data privacy is a legitimate concern when using AI systems with student information.


[TT4G35J] - AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students: I would say "Agree" - AI might recommend teaching methods that don't fit established best practices or the particular needs of my classroom context.
